vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-equality
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.forceClose (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#616-621) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender == channels[_channel].receiver)

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-equality
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.forceClose (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#616-621) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender == channels[_channel].receiver)
GNTPaymentChannels.isLocked (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#523-525) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- channels[_channel].locked_until == 0

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-equality
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.forceClose (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#616-621) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender == channels[_channel].receiver)
GNTPaymentChannels.isLocked (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#523-525) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- channels[_channel].locked_until == 0
GNTPaymentChannels.isValidSig (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#536-539) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- (channels[_ch].owner) == (ecrecover(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)(sha3()(_ch,_value),_v,_r,_s))

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-equality
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.forceClose (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#616-621) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender == channels[_channel].receiver)
GNTPaymentChannels.isLocked (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#523-525) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- channels[_channel].locked_until == 0
GNTPaymentChannels.isValidSig (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#536-539) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- (channels[_ch].owner) == (ecrecover(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)(sha3()(_ch,_value),_v,_r,_s))
GNTPaymentChannels.onlyOwner (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#482-485) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender == channels[_channel].owner)
	- require(bool)(msg.sender == channels[_channel].owner)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in GNTPaymentChannels._do_close (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#638-653):
	External calls:
	- token.transfer(ch.owner,amount) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#644-651)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- channels (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#649)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in GNTPaymentChannels._do_withdraw (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#625-636):
	External calls:
	- token.transfer(ch.receiver,_amount) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#630-634)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- channels (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#631)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in GNTPaymentChannels.fund (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#565-578):
	External calls:
	- token.transferFrom(msg.sender,address(this),_amount) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#571-576)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- channels (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#572)
	- channels (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#573)

vulnerability_findings.name: unused-return
vulnerability_findings.message:
TokenProxy.withdrawTo (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#360-371) does not use the value returned by external calls:
	-TOKEN.transfer(_destination,_value) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#368)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in TokenProxy.transferFromGate (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#336-354):
	External calls:
	- value = TOKEN.balanceOf(gate) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#344)
	- Gate(gate).transferToProxy(value) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#346)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- balances (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#351)
	- totalSupply_ (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#350)

vulnerability_findings.name: timestamp
vulnerability_findings.message:
GolemNetworkTokenBatching.batchTransfer (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#402-421) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- require(bool)(block.timestamp >= closureTime) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#403)

vulnerability_findings.name: timestamp
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function isLocked(bytes32 _channel) public returns (bool) {

        return channels[_channel].locked_until == 0;
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.isLocked (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#523-525) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- channels[_channel].locked_until == 0 (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#524)

vulnerability_findings.name: timestamp
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code:
function isTimeLocked(bytes32 _channel) public view returns (bool) {

        return channels[_channel].locked_until >= block.timestamp;
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.isTimeLocked (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#527-529) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- channels[_channel].locked_until >= block.timestamp (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#528)

vulnerability_findings.name: timestamp
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.isUnlocked (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#531-534) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- ((channels[_channel].locked_until != 0) && (channels[_channel].locked_until < block.timestamp)) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#532-533)

vulnerability_findings.name: timestamp
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.isValidSig (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#536-539) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- (channels[_ch].owner) == (ecrecover(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)(sha3()(_ch,_value),_v,_r,_s)) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#538)

vulnerability_findings.name: timestamp
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.forceClose (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#616-621) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- require(bool)(msg.sender == channels[_channel].receiver) (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#619)

vulnerability_findings.name: assembly
vulnerability_findings.message:
GNTPaymentChannels.onTokenReceived uses assembly (GNTPaymentChannels.sol#552-561)
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#554-557

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in GNTPaymentChannels.sol:
	- Version used: ['^0.4.16', '^0.4.18', '^0.4.19']
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#4 declares pragma solidity^0.4.19
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#14 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#31 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#82 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#132 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#148 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#252 declares pragma solidity^0.4.19
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#380 declares pragma solidity^0.4.19
	- GNTPaymentChannels.sol#436 declares pragma solidity^0.4.16

vulnerability_findings.name: deprecated-standards
vulnerability_findings.message:
Deprecated standard detected @ GNTPaymentChannels.sol#538:
	- Usage of "sha3()" should be replaced with "keccak256()"

vulnerability_findings.name: deprecated-standards
vulnerability_findings.message:
Deprecated standard detected @ GNTPaymentChannels.sol#546:
	- Usage of "sha3()" should be replaced with "keccak256()"
